noise.__discription: power of noise replacement in dB in referance to the original signal. For example 0 is equal, 20 is strong noise, -20 is weak noise

SNR.__discription: can only ever reduce SNR to whatever lvl provided is, if level is higher no change

phase_rotation.__discription: [min,max,step] gets input to range(min,max,step) then selected randomly

FSPL._comment_distance_range: [min,max] gets input to range(min,max) then selected randomly for attenuation of signal
FSPL.__discription: path loss coeficient, goes into simplified calculation of 1/d^alpha. alpha=2 is open air. indoor los ~1.6. Urban area ~2.7-3.5. Indoor obstructed ~4-6

IQ_imbalance._comment_gain_factor: Gain imbalance factor, where 1.02 indicates a 2% increase from the ideal gain, typical range is 1.00 to 1.02 for minimal to noticeable, up to 1.05 for lower quality SDRs.
IQ_imbalance.__discription: Phase imbalance in degrees, where 3 degrees is a realistic setting for many commercial SDRs. Typical range is ±0.5 to ±5 degrees, can go up to ±10 degrees in less sophisticated systems.
